content.raw:
It used to be fun a year ago, now it is just nightmare :wink: … so if you are aware that some worlds do not work I would remove them, so that competitors do not waste any of the remaining time with it. I used “Virtual STIX” as example of “unknown tunnel”, tried couple times to deploy docker and when it finally passed I found out that the world is not shifted … but maybe you understand me.

Regarding hard-code scenario … yes, you are right, but you do not have to run it locally, and may explore it on AWS only. That is actually the fun part :slight_smile:  …

Maybe one note regarding score \(I am not sure if to create another Issue, probably not now\) would be option to remove your attempt from fun-table … like our test in Practice Tunnel 01, when we tested if you can report artifacts you did not visit from tunnel entrance.

‌

It used to be fun a year ago, now it is just nightmare … so if you are aware that some worlds do not work I would remove them, so that competitors do not waste any of the remaining time with it. I used “Virtual STIX” as example of “unknown tunnel”, tried couple times to deploy docker and when it finally passed I found out that the world is not shifted … but maybe you understand me.

Regarding hard-code scenario … yes, you are right, but you do not have to run it locally, and may explore it on AWS only. That is actually the fun part …

Maybe one note regarding score (I am not sure if to create another Issue, probably not now) would be option to remove your attempt from fun-table … like our test in Practice Tunnel 01, when we tested if you can report artifacts you did not visit from tunnel entrance.
